misdeed: Crops have begun to wither and die in the fields surrounding a small village, and livestock refuse to graze in the pastures. The air is thick with the smell of decay and fear.
solution: The Vaesen is an Ash Tree Wife and can be destroyed by burning or cutting down the ash tree it inhabits.

clues.description: The villagers mention a large, ancient ash tree at the edge of the blighted area that has always been regarded with superstition.
A local woodsman claims to have seen a beautiful woman with bark-like skin and long, flowing green hair near the ash tree, but she vanished when he approached.
The soil around the ash tree is unnaturally fertile, despite the blight affecting the surrounding land. Strange flowers bloom there, their petals a sickly pale green.
Whispering voices seem to emanate from the ash tree at night, speaking of forgotten rituals and offerings.
An old woman tells a story about a young girl who was sacrificed to the ash tree generations ago to ensure a bountiful harvest. She claims the girl's spirit is trapped within the tree.
Thorns and brambles seem to grow with unnatural speed and aggression around the ash tree, forming a nearly impenetrable barrier.
The air grows noticeably colder and heavier the closer one gets to the ash tree, as if an unseen presence chills the very air.

plotTwist.description: The village elder had been making offerings to the Vaesen to ensure a good harvest, but stopped when his only granddaughter moved away.
